changelog.release_notes: * Timeline updates given longer to update. (Firmware 3.x)

* Medications now appear on your timeline and can be "taken" from the timeline, so you don't really need to load the app itself anymore! (Firmware 3.x)
* Improved layout on Pebble Time Round (Firmware 3.x)
* Under the hood improvements (Firmware 3.x)
* Under the hood improvements (Firmware 2.x)
Multiple watches connected to the same phone will always use the latest data.

Configuration page on phone for easier medication entry.
DONATIONS can be accepted from the configuration page!
Timers can be flexible (timer starts from when you ACTUALLY took the meds) or fixed (timer starts from when you SHOULD have taken the meds).
First version.

data.description:
Track your regular medications to always know what drugs to take when.  Never forget to take your pills, medicine or tablets again!

Features:
* Track unlimited medications.
* Next medication times appear on your timeline, and can be reset from the timeline.
* Long press on medication to reset timer when you take the medication.
* Set regular repeat intervals for each medication.
* Vibration reminders when next medication is due, even when app isn't running (optional).
* Sort medication list so next medication is at the top (optional).
* Timers can be flexible (timer starts from when you ACTUALLY took the meds) or fixed (timer starts from when you SHOULD have taken the meds).

latest_release.release_notes: * Timeline updates given longer to update. (Firmware 3.x)

data.title: Medication Timer

data.author: Rob Cornice
data.description:
Eine App die euch den aktuellen Stand der Online-Mitzeichner der E-Petition 61453 des Deutschen Bundestages anzeigt.

https://epetitionen.bundestag.de/petitionen/_2015/_10/_07/Petition_61453.html

Verbraucherschutz - Keine Umsetzung von Artikel 20 Tabakproduktrichtlinie 2014/40/EU (elektronische Zigaretten) vom 07.10.2015

Der Deutsche Bundestag möge beschließen, dass die neue Tabakrichtlinienverordnung (Artikel 20), die die "elektronische Zigarette" betrifft, nicht umgesetzt werden soll.
data.title: Petition 61453

data.description:
Your battery will be very sad if you leave this app on for a long time.

If you like this app, give it a heart!

A simple heart-rate checker for your pebble! Are you ever sad because the pebble can't track your heart rate? Well, problem solved!

Put your index and middle fingers right under your chin and to the right. If you are not moving, you'll feel beating. That's your heart rate. While you're doing this, hit select on the app, then start counting the beats. Once you count 10 beats, immediately hit select again. You'll then get your heart rate!

latest_release.release_notes: Now with logs! Hit down to access. Also, new homescreen

data.title: Heart Rate Checker

changelog.release_notes:
- Bug fix: now correctly showing negative temperatures
- Added version for Pebble Time 2 #denial #pebblerocks

- Better loader animation on Pebble Time Round
- Updated Buienradar API

- Added diorite support
- Added app menu icon
- Bug fixes
- Added option to use the initial radial graph again on Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel
- More small bugfixes
- Small bugfixes
- Small bug fixes

- Added kiezelpay
- Vibrate as new data is fetched
- Multiple locations
- Adjust scale of graph
- Sunshine / moonshine graph
- Added mm/inch option
- Fixed a bug that cause the app to crash on startup for the Pebble Classic and Pebble Classic Steel

- Added 12h format
- Fixed major bug that caused the app to crash after many refreshes
- Bug fixes

- Added temperature on short-term view for Buienradar and forecast.io
- Fixed a bug when the 'USA/UK/Ireland' option would become 'Other countries 1h' when opening the config page again
- Better graph layout

- Long press the select button to toggle between short- and long-term forecasts
- Added temperature when provided by selected API 
- Added option to choose °C or °F
- Added option to adjust refresh interval
- Added option to use a general API Key when using forecast.io
- Minor bug fixes
- Fixed crash when using buttons when there was no data loaded yet

- Long pressing buttons makes it easier to scroll trough time now
- Fixed minor bugs

- added support for USA, UK and Ireland (data-point every minute)
- added support worldwide (data-point every hour)
- added support worldwide (data-point every 3 hours)
- option for not using GPS
- minor tweaks and improvements

data.description:
Get a graph of the upcoming rain for your location for the next few moments. Ideal for checking if you need an umbrella or not when you're going out walking / cycling / hunting Pokémons with Pokémon go.

USA / UK / Ireland
Data-point every minute. Rain data provided by forecast.io
(make sure to add your API key or choose the general key)

Belgium / The Netherlands
Data-point every 5 minutes. Rain data provided by buienradar.nl

Other countries
Data-point every hour. Rain data provided by forecast.io
(make sure to add your API key or choose the general key)

As I'm spending a lot of my spare time developing this app I kindly ask you to buy me a drink ($1.99 excl VAT). In return you'll get a lot of extra features:
- Multiple locations
- Long-term forecasts
- Sunshine / moonshine graph
- Vibrate as new data is fetched
- Adjust the scale of the graph
- More frequent auto-refresh options
- Manually fetch new data
- A happy me

Give it a heart if you like it :)

latest_release.release_notes:
- Bug fix: now correctly showing negative temperatures
- Added version for Pebble Time 2 #denial #pebblerocks

data.title: Rain

data.description:
Log your time spent on different projects or activities.  Helps you complete your timesheet at the end of the week, or just see where the time went!

Only one timer runs at a time, so as soon as you start one job, all the other jobs are automatically paused - you can only do one thing at a time!

Features:
* Unlimited projects/jobs/activities
* Day unit is customisable (eg, 8 hrs, 24 hours, or however long your working day is).
* Move active timer to the top of the list (optional) so the most common tasks automatically move near the top.
* Display current time above the list of jobs (optional).

latest_release.release_notes: Data syncs properly between watches connected to the same phone.

data.title: Job Timer

data.author: Jeff Hildebrandt
data.description:
Burabuchi, the virtual pet app.  Take care of your burabuchi and watch as it grows into a marvelous being of total perfection. Your burabuchi has the potential to grow into three mid-evolutions and nine final evolutions! All dependent on how well you take care of your burabuchi.  You can squander its limitless potential or nurture it until it grows into the ultimate being.  Make sure to take really good care of it all the way until the end for it to live on!

The app has visual indicators for your burabuchi's status and cut-scenes for each action.  Also, a super-secret, secret menu where you'll be able to see all of its evolutions! hint: press down five times on the normal menu and hit the middle button

Good luck bringing all the untapped potential out of your burabuchi!!!
data.title: Burabuchi

data.author: Derek

changelog.release_notes: Just in time for the ashes. Added an experimental data provider: CRICINFO2. Its the same as CRICINFO for the actual score, however sometimes the list of games stops being updated. This is because sometimes the CRICINFO RSS page does not get updated, CRICINFO2 uses the live scores HTML page for the list of games.

Just in time for the IPL there are some bug fixes
- Vibrate alerts now respect quiet time
- Wicket vibrate alert now works correctly on the last wicket in an innings

Added support for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2
Fixed CRICAPI data provider
Switched default provider to CRICINFO
App now remembers which view you were using on the watch (Main, Detail or Watch) and will use this the next time it is launched

Added settings screen so that the vibrate alerts can be switched on and off.
The three vibrate alerts can be switch on and off individually: 
- when a wicket falls, 
- when the bluetooth connection to the phone is lost, 
- if wrist-spin exits or is forced to exit

Data provider can be selected on the watch.
Changed navigation so that you can loop through the score displays using the up and down buttons.
You can now exit the app and select the current game from any score screen.
Added alerts for "no phone" and "xx mins old" stale data.
Added vibrate alert if the link to the phone is lost.
Fixed a bug where the score would freeze if blue-tooth was switched on and off quickly.
Centered AM/PM time correctly on large display.
Added open source licenses.
Switched data provider from CRICSCORE to CRICAPI
Added layouts for Pebble Time Round
Initial Release

data.description:
wrist-spin
** March 2017: This app is still being maintained. I still own a pebble and use the app. It does not use Pebble for any of its back-end data providers. The only part I do rely on is the Pebble app on your phone, as long as that works this app should function ** 
Get up to the minute live cricket scores on your wrist with this free app. It is a watch app so that you can carry on using your existing watch face.If you like it then please give it a heart.
- Up and down buttons loop through the score displays: watch (just score and time), main (score, and strikers, overs and time), detail (full details).
- Middle button select the game to follow and the data provider to use. 
- Back button to exit.
- Wrist-spin will remember the last game you selected if you exit, or another application forces wrist-spin to exit.
- Vibrate when a wicket falls, the innings ends, wrist-spin exits or the link to the watch is lost.
- Status display will show if the score has not changed for over 10 minutes.
- Powered by multiple data sources for fast reliable up to date scores.

latest_release.release_notes: Just in time for the ashes. Added an experimental data provider: CRICINFO2. Its the same as CRICINFO for the actual score, however sometimes the list of games stops being updated. This is because sometimes the CRICINFO RSS page does not get updated, CRICINFO2 uses the live scores HTML page for the list of games.

data.title: wrist-spin

data.description:
MyLOL is the latest and greatest League of Legends Companion app for Pebble!

Features:
* Profile and Game History Data
* Current Game data with images
* Free Champion Rotation
* Built in Pebble to Pebble Messenger 

Getting Started:
* Download the app to your Pebble Time and/or Pebble Time Round.
* Open configuration page:

 > Enter a summoner name

For more information visit: https://github.com/MitchellRoy/MyLOL-Pebble-App

MyLOL isn’t endorsed by Riot Games and doesn’t reflect the views or opinions of Riot Games or anyone officially involved in producing or managing League of Legends. League of Legends and Riot Games are trademarks or registered trademarks of Riot Games, Inc. League of Legends © Riot Games, Inc.

data.description:
FhemControl brings your home to your wrist!
All you need is a FHEM-Server with jsonlist2 enabled. Enter your ip-adress and start controlling your home directly from your Pebble smartwatch.

At the moment FhemControl supports the following devices:
-CUL devices (IT) (on/off)
-Philipps Hue devices (on/off)
-HomeMatic switches (on/off)
-FS20 (fs20fms, fs20st) (on/off)

If you like FhemControl, pleas give an ❤️.
You have new ideas and feature requests? Feel free to contact me!

Interested but no idea what FHEM is? Check http://fhem.de/

data.author: amcolash

changelog.release_notes:
V 2.2: Bugs, variables and more - oh my!

Firstly, this update should fix all issues that people were having with being unable to input their full keys into the app.

Secondly and most exciting - there are new "variables" you can input into your triggers, so things like health data and location data. For this reason, the app now asks for some permissions. Hopefully it is useful as some people have asked for the functionality!

Finally, I have added some other fixes and improvements behind the scenes.

V 2.1 - Add in timeout to automatically close after not being used for a while, add more slots for triggers (16 total), squash bugs that were causing menus to not load back correctly and seg faults, add text stating you need to configure your settings

V 2.0 - Complete re-write of the original app. This version is way faster to load and should be much better overall. There is now a limit to the number of triggers that can be stored (right now 12, but I will probably change that soon). Also, you will need to re-do your configuration.

Let me know if there are any problems with the new app, I am loving the speed! More to come in the future.
V 1.9 - Add in support for sending a value with your trigger to IFTTT
V 1.8 - Support for Pebble Time Round
V 1.7 - Changing web page hosting to github pages (sorry for the outage for the last week, I changed raspberry pi's) :P
V 1.6 - Actually fix the timeout in some cases. Yay!
V 1.5 - Auto close app after 10 minutes (will add toggle in future)
V 1.4 - Fix issue with window stacking
V 1.3 - Add color options for menu, vibrate on menu action select
V1.2 - Fix menu problems
V1.1 - Fix problems with the web config page
V1.0 of app

data.description: IoT Buddy is an app to send commands to the Maker channel of IFTTT. Currently is supports sending a simple POST to the channel. You can add as many event triggers as you want to the list and can harness the full power of IFTTT from your wrist!

latest_release.release_notes:
V 2.2: Bugs, variables and more - oh my!

Firstly, this update should fix all issues that people were having with being unable to input their full keys into the app.

Secondly and most exciting - there are new "variables" you can input into your triggers, so things like health data and location data. For this reason, the app now asks for some permissions. Hopefully it is useful as some people have asked for the functionality!

Finally, I have added some other fixes and improvements behind the scenes.

data.title: IoT Buddy

data.author: Jackson Kruger

changelog.release_notes: - Added alternative option for arrow functioning. It allows direct movement between different bookmarks, through a double click of the up or down button. Find it in the Settings at the bottom of the bookmark list.

Version 2.0 is here!
- Massive internal overhaul allowing... multiple bookmarks!
- Moved voice dictation and keyboard into a sub-menu
- Moved bookmark-specific settings into bookmark edit menu (up button)
- Various other bug fixes/improvements

- Added ability to keep movie/tv show bookmarks
- Added settings
- Redesigned action bar interaction to be more intuitive
- Moved delete button to edit action menu
- Maybe reduced battery consumption?

- Can now specify tough titles using the T3 keyboard. Many thanks to cnucci for this. Source: https://github.com/cnucci/t3-keyboard
- Modified T3 keyboard to be usable on Pebble Time Round.
- Reworked appearance
Initial Release

data.description:
Bookmark allows you to track your page number in a book. Really, it can count anything. It permanently saves the number so you never lose track.

New! Bookmark can now track multiple books and TV shows at once!

Bookmark can be used to save the page number in books as well as time in TV shows. You no longer have to pick just one book or one TV show, now you can track them all at once. Track your current book, netflix episode, podcast, youtube video, and whatever else you may want to track all at the same time. 

You can specify the title of the book using either voice dictation or the T3 keyboard.

T3 Keyboard Controls:
- Each button corresponds to a row of characters. Short press the corresponding button to cycle through the columns.
- Long press the buttons to access the different keyboard layouts.
- Double press the back button to backspace.
- Access the space character on the "yz " key.

latest_release.release_notes: - Added alternative option for arrow functioning. It allows direct movement between different bookmarks, through a double click of the up or down button. Find it in the Settings at the bottom of the bookmark list.

data.title: Bookmark

data.author: JoRy

changelog.release_notes: Application configuration transfered.
Bug fixes.
Minor text correction.

Added Sleep Timer control.
Enable it in Fast Switch configuration - LONG press SELECT button on main screen.
Volume refresh fix.

Minor fix when Volume changing. Should be faster now.
Changed name to Denon Remote to fit whole name to application menu on Pebble watch.

* UPDATE commands DB - LONG press Menu/Input icon and select "Update commands" from menu!

This version brings new and faster way how to change between device controls - Fast switching.
Fast Switch is mapped to SELECT button and switch configured controls directly on main screen.
Fast Switch (SELECT button) can be configured by LONG press.
Configured controls can be aranged on main screen by deselecting them all and then select in order as you wish them on main screen.

Main screen is automatically refreshed when shown. 
Refresh button assigned to 'Down' button will be removed later.

Update: New GUI. Description: This remote application for you Pebble or Pebble Time watch can control your DENON (and Marantz) receiver. Just connect your phone to same (WiFi) network as your receiver and you will loose your regular remote shortly. Should be able to control any receiver made by 2011 and later. Database of commands can be easily customized for this application so let me know if you need any other control and especially if you are DENON http server developer.

This remote application for you Pebble or Pebble Time watch can control your DENON (and Marantz) receiver. Just connect your phone to same (WiFi) network as your receiver and you will loose your regular remote shortly. Should be able to control any receiver made by 2011 and later. Database of commands can be easily customized for this application so let me know if you need any other control and especially if you are DENON http server developer.

data.description:
This remote application for you Pebble or Pebble Time watch can control your DENON (and Marantz) receiver. Just connect your phone to the same (WiFi) network as your receiver and you will loose your regular remote shortly.

Should be able to control any receiver made by 2011 and later. Database of commands can be easily customized for this application.
More info about Fast Switch and list of supported models you can find here https://goo.gl/Kspw9f

* Read VERSION INFORMATION below to know what is new in Pebble application.
* Ensure the IP CONTROL is set on 'Always On' and FRIENDLY NAME is set to default value under NETWORK settings section of your receiver.
* IP Address of receiver can be found when press SETUP button on your regular remote and navigate to Network > Information > IP Address.

latest_release.release_notes: Application configuration transfered.

data.title: Denon Remote

changelog.release_notes: - Optimizations and Bugfixes

data.description:
Looking for fast and easy to use timer? A timer which deals with foreground - background switching in an intuitive way?

Here it is - the Fast Timer Pebble App. You can interact with Fast Timer with the following actions:

up & down: adjust timer
select: run timer

long press on up & down: adjust timer by 15 minutes steps
long press on select: stop running timer and reset it to 00:00.

Send Fast Timer to background - doesn't matter - the timer works perfectly also in the background. Bringing it back to the foreground - the current timer is shown where it is right now! Smooth and intuitive!

latest_release.release_notes: - Optimizations and Bugfixes

data.title: Fast Timer

data.author: Olivier Gérardin

data.description:
A Pebble watchapp for displaying parking occupancy in Luxembourg city using the RSS feed provided by Ville de Luxembourg.

The first screen shows a list of city areas. If you select an area, you will see the list of parkings for that area, with additional information:
-number of available spaces / total spaces
-an icon indicating occupancy trend
-the text will be green if the parking has available spaces, red if it's full or closed

latest_release.release_notes:
Optimization: data is kept in cache and server is not queried again if last query was less than 30 seconds ago.
Time of last query is displayed at the top of parkings page.
Memory footprint reduced for aplite (Pebble classic).

data.title: LuxParking

data.description:
Mopidy-Player is a remote control for the mopidy service. Control the volume, playback, add songs from your playlist to the queue and remove from songs the queue.

Make sure you have access to the mopidy's web service: ws://<ip>:<port>/mopidy/ws/

--- How to use ---
* Now Playing:
    - Up = volume up
    - Down = volume down
    - Long Up = previous song
    - Long Down = next song
* Queue:
    - Select = Play song
    - Long Select = Delete from queue
* Browse Folders:
    - Select = Open folder
    - Long Select = Menu to add all contents of folder to the queue

latest_release.release_notes: Show watch config to Settings Page

data.title: Mopidy-Player

changelog.release_notes: Emery support

Initial release.

data.description:
The Aevitaz Pregnancy Tracker provides weekly or daily pins in your timeline reminding you how far along in your pregnancy you are, plus a useful piece of trivia.

Set up is easy, just specify either your estimated due date, the date of conception, or your last menstrual period, plus the frequency and time of the notifications and the pregnancy tracker will do the rest! It also supports toggling between who is pregnant (i.e. you or your partner).

This initial version only provides pregnancy tracking, but the plan is to expand it to include post-birth feeding and sleep tracking, plus other useful things to do with babies and pregnancy. Pre-birth pregnancy planning is also on the list.

If you have any ideas for features that would be useful, please reach out and let me know!

I am making this for my wife who is currently pregnant, and I hope you find it as useful as we do! :-)

latest_release.release_notes: Emery support

data.title: Aevitaz - Pregnancy Tracker

data.author: Chris Wong

changelog.release_notes: Added loading and error messages. Now you no longer have to face a dark screen for seconds when CoffeeTime is searching for nearby coffee shops!
v1.0: Thanks for using CoffeeTime! This is our very first release with the basic functionalities of locating coffee shops around us. We'd love to hear your feedback to continue improving this app.

data.description:
Ever have that moment when you are trying to find coffee shops in an area you're not familiar with? Fret not, CoffeeTime is here to guide you. 

All you have to do is to launch CoffeeTime, and you will see a list of nearby coffee shops along with its distance (This process could take up to 5 seconds as your phone's GPS pinpoints your location). Click into it and you can see the store's address so you know which direction to go!

- Possible Use Cases -
> Experiencing caffeine withdrawal in an unfamiliar territory
> Craving for coffee while stuck at a traffic light
> Suggesting a #coffeemeetup with your buddies
> Not sure where to bring your crush to a coffee date without awkwardly checking your phone

Last but not least: We do not store your location information nor do we collect any other data. Now you can look for coffee right at your wrist!

latest_release.release_notes: Added loading and error messages. Now you no longer have to face a dark screen for seconds when CoffeeTime is searching for nearby coffee shops!

data.title: CoffeeTime

data.author: Roman Matiasko
data.description:
An app that allows you to execute remote files from your pebble. The app needs a companion app, server, to be running on your local network and to be accessible via HTTP.

The number of files that you can execute is not limited, and you also get visual feedback in form of message. The message contains whatever was written to stdout or stderr.

More info and companion server can be found at https://github.com/romanmatiasko/exec-file-pebble
data.title: Exec File

data.description:
A simple control watchapp for the basic functions of your network-enabled Yamaha AV receiver. Never look for the remote again!

Tested on a RX-V479 but should work on all models compatible with the official AV CONTROLLER smartphone app using the YNC/A protocol.

This watchapp is unofficial and not endorsed or supported by Yamaha.

Features:
- Power toggle - standby/on*
- Volume control & mute
- 2-click preset scene launch, or manual input selection (HDMI, Spotify, Pandora, Airplay, Sirius, Net Radio, USB, Bluetooth, UPnP, Tuner...)**
- DSP program selection
- Basic playback control & info - previous track, next track, play/pause (if supported by the source)
- Near real-time status updates, no need to refresh manually

Not supported:
- Multiple devices or multiple zones
- Source browsing (menus)
- Advanced sound & video settings

* Ensure the 'Network Standby' feature is activated to be able to control/turn on the device when in standby mode.
** The available scenes & inputs are retrieved from the device configuration and may differ depending on the settings, the model and market availability.

latest_release.release_notes: Fix: wrong command sent when skipping forward

data.title: Yamaha AV Remote

It requires version 3.3 of the OnFit phone app from the Play store.

Version 3.1 adds an additional screen with a detailed view of your day stats (kcal/kj consumed vs target and steps walked vs target)

Please update the Android companion app to version 3.1 from the Play store to enjoy the new features.

data.description:
OnFit is a stylish watchapp that connects to your phone and informs you at a glance on your progress towards your nutritional and exercise goals.

The OnFit Android app is the simplest most effective app for taking control of your diet and fitness goals.

Keep track of the calories you eat using our large food database which can be augmented with your own food items.

Keep track of your weight over time.

Specify your daily calorie and weight targets. OnFit will let you know if you are meeting or exceeding your set targets.

latest_release.release_notes:

It requires version 3.3 of the OnFit phone app from the Play store.

data.description:
The Egg Timer based on the formula of Charles D.H. Williams is really easy to use. Before you start simply create a new configuration ("New..." in the main menu) which fits your egg and location (mind the elevation!). You can save as many configurations as you like. To start the timer scroll down to the configuration you want to use and click the select button.
Enjoy your (free range, I hope) egg!

latest_release.release_notes: First maintenance release. Now the timer also rings when you leave the app. So you can adjust the music while waiting for your eggs to boil. Also, the app icon is now properly shown in the menu. Third improvement is that the timer now vibrates twice, just in case you miss the first vibration.

data.description:
This app allows you to accurately track your period. Simply enter the begin and end on the watch. The app learns your cycle (after one completed cycle) and will remind you 3 days and 1 day in advance via the Timeline.

- NEW: Information about your next period is now directly shown in the launcher.

All your data is only stored on the watch itself and not sent to some server!

If you don't like the heart symbol, simply press up or down while on the main screen.

If you like the app, give it a heart in the app store!

data.description:
Battery- uses the activity tracker slot to gather all battery-related events and store them for further display.

This is very similar to Battery+ from Ycleptic Studios, except that data is not processed, the battery events are displayed directly as reported by the firmware.

Battery- was written while waiting for Battery+ to be ported on the PTR, but it could be useful to anyone who wants access to raw battery data in order to process it themselves.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Add the possibility to start and stop the worker from the main app menu
- The new menu item also indicates whether the worker is currently running or not

data.description:
A simple colourful timer for Pebble Round / Chalk but can run in Basalt (Pebble Steel etc. the positioning is a bit off though). Time up to 100 hours with 1 second precision! Simple to use and incredibly handy with features including: The ability to enter hours minutes and seconds independently The ability to go back (by shaking it) if you entered the wrong time (only works on timer input screen) A clear UI with a ring that decreases in circumference as time passes - being invisible when time's up It also shows the current time, the time remaining and the time it will be when the timer has run out Upon completion the timer will vibrate once a second until you shake it! It will also light the watch up every other second.

Can be paused by pressing middle button.

data.author: Ayoub
data.description:
Learn how to talk like Yoda - just dictate to your watch and let the magic happens.

Try it with jokes, song lyrics, short messages, whatever!

Tips:

 - Please don't just try "Hello." Nothing will change. Yoda won't answer back, he'll just repeat. It's not the same thing as a conversation.

- In the Star Wars movies, Yoda speaks short sentences. So keep that in mind when learning the Yodish language! 

This app is powered by yoda speak webservice. (http://www.yodaspeak.co.uk/ )

I'd like to thank Roger Leblanc for his collaboration, you can check his app "Last weather".

If you experience any issues with the app drop me a line : ayoub.briki@gmail.com

data.author: Automata Development
data.description:
A scoring app for the 2015-2016 VRC game VEX Nothing But Net.

Features:
 - Designed for rapid in-match score estimation
 - Match timer
 - 30 sec, 15 sec, and 5 sec warning vibration

How to Use:
 - Press the up button to add 5 points to the red score
 - Press the down button to add 5 points to the blue score
 - Press the select button to toggle the autonomous winner
 - Hold the up button to start a 1:45 timer
 - Hold the down button to start a 1:00 timer
 - Hold the select button to reset the scores and the timer

data.description:
A customizable HTTP request WatchApp perfect for Home Automation. The configuration page allows you to test requests before publishing to your Pebble.

Configure any number of HTTP GET/POST requests on your phone and fire them off on your watch. Setup JSON data for POST calls on the phone. Use the configuration page to create, delete, reorder and test individual HTTP requests.

The Pebble interface provides feedback of each call attempt with HTTP status codes (200, 401, 404, etc). Requests are sent asynchronously, so you don't have to wait for a response before firing off another call. Setting the volume on your audio device has never been easier.

Save time by testing your requests on the configuration page before making it available on your Pebble. Also if you're sending JSON data, test the formatting right on the phone app.

Setup Demo Video:
https://youtu.be/BL3GRCVes80

Fearture Roadmap:
- Color
- Additional Status field display options
- Basic Authentication

latest_release.release_notes: Corrected status bar offset

data.title: HTTP Push

data.author: wjljack

changelog.release_notes: 更新：背光常亮，方便阅读。

cnBeta阅读器继续优化阅读体验，带来更成熟的1.4版本~~~
此版本缩小了字体的显示，能够在满屏状态下显示更多的新闻内容~~~
1.减小字体大小，方便阅读更多的新闻。
2.去掉新闻摘要的滚动显示方式，统一摘要和正文都采用翻页的方式。在同屏显示更多内容的情况下，提升了阅读体验，减少了按键的损耗。
[ps:开发者在中途入了ticwatch，所以暂停了一段时间更新，最后发现tic、aw等表续航和功能都不满意，目前回到了OG pebble，以后会有更多新闻类应用上架pebble，敬请期待~~~联系我扣扣185261784]

修正ios设备乱码问题。
应网友要求，使用短名称。

增加ios支持。
增加正文页面甩动翻页功能。
增加新闻正文分页查看功能。让您可以在pebble上看到完整的资讯。

1.修正菜单图标。
2.修改Loading界面。
3.去掉文章中不必要的html标记。

data.description:
Super simple watch app for pebble devs.  Lets you track how many hearts your apps are getting.  Tracks up to 5 apps.

- Application name is whatever name you want to show on your pebble.
- Application ID is the 24 digit alphanumeric which identifies your app on the dev-portal.  When you select your app in the dev-portal it is in the web address.
- Select button updates heart information
- Oh, and it shows the time, because Pebble is a watch, right?

Give it a heart if you like it...I'm watching:)

latest_release.release_notes: Select button updates information

data.title: Hearts Matter

data.author: Mike D

changelog.release_notes: New color scheme

data.description:
Info Timer is a voice controlled countdown timer, chronograph with a tachymeter/telemeter and a calendar. 
Control the chronograph with the UP button. One click to start. One click to stop. Hold to reset. 
Press the DOWN button to start dictation. Say "five minute timer", "one hour timer" or "two hour, 37 minute, 52 second timer" to start a countdown timer. 
If you open Info Timer by using a Quick Launch and no other timers are running, you will go directly to the voice input. To leave the voice input, shake the watch. You can exit the app and your timer will still wake the app up just before the timer runs out and vibrates. 
Press SELECT to view a calendar. The current month and day are shown. Press UP or DOWN to go back or forward, month by month. Press SELECT or BACK to exit the calendar.

latest_release.release_notes: New color scheme

data.title: Info Timer

data.description:
Are you frustrated with game dice? Shake2Roll is for you! Whether you're playing Yahtzee or Dungeons & Dragons or exploring probability in a math class, you can use this app.

Press the middle button to choose how many dice you want to roll (up to six). Then, choose how many sides you want each dice to have (from two to one hundred). Then, shake to roll.

data.description:
Find your phone from your watch.
No need to get someone to phone you.
If you misplace or lose your phone, open this app to make your phone ring. If your phone isn't connected, the Bluetooth is set to high power mode: walk around and your watch will search out your phone.
Your Android phone vibrates, plays your alarm sound on full volume, and turns the screen on white.
